title: SMC_TriggerPosition_Plane (Struct)
text:
TYPE SMC_TriggerPosition_Plane : STRUCT
Defines a plane.
The plane is defined as the set of all vectors v with
<v, NormalVector> = Distance,
where <,> is the standard scalar product.

rows.Name: NormalVector
rows.Comment: The normal vector of the plane, must be a unit vector.

rows.Name: Distance
rows.Comment:
The distance of the plane to the origin.  Must be non-
negative.

rows.Name: CoordSystem
rows.Comment:
The coordinate system in which the normal vector is
defined.  Must be a cartesian coordinate system.  The
TCS (tool coordinate system) is not supported.If the movement is defined in a dynamic coordinate system,
then this coordinate system must be identical to the
coordinate system of the start and target position of the
movement.Note that the coordinate system is evaluated when the movement
of this trigger is commanded.  For example, say PCS_1 is changed
between the call ofSMC_GroupPrepareTriggerand the call of the
movement function block.  Then the trigger plane is evaluated
in the changed coordinate system.
